alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 5:09PM MST until August 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 1100 PM MST. * At 509 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Surprise, Wittmann, Circle City and Morristown. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 118 and 127. AZ Route 74 near mile marker 1...and between mile markers 10 and 14...and between mile markers 2 and 5. This includes the following streams and drainages... San Domingo Wash, Ox Wash, Morgan City Wash, Beardsley Canal, Agua Fria River, Cottonwood Creek, Trilby Wash, Hassayampa River, Tub Spring Wash and Little San Domingo Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
